snippet.title: Sydney couple to face terror-plot trial
snippet.content: A young Sydney couple has been ordered to stand trial on charges related to plotting a terrorist attack. Alo-Bridget Namoa had allegedly once described herself and her husband, Sameh Bayda, as an "Islamic Bonnie and Clyde" and wrote him a "goodbye love note" saying she wanted to have his child as a memento. In the Downing Centre Local Court on Monday, magistrate Susan Horan committed the two 20-year-olds to stand trial in the Supreme Court where the case will be mentioned on September 1. Originally published as
